thread.title: What you should know about Glass-Steagall
thread.title_full: What you should know about Glass-Steagall

title: What you should know about Glass-Steagall
text:
Glass-Steagall: The Debate Term You Should Probably Know Elizabeth Hagedorn 10:41 PM, Oct 13, 2015 
Photo Credit: U.S. House of Representatives 
During the Democratic debate, these two names came up a lot. 
Glass and Steagall are the authors of the Glass-Steagall Act, a law passed in 1933 that prohibited financial institutions from conducting regular commercial banking alongside riskier investments. 
In 1999, President Bill Clinton repealed it â€” which some critics say contributed to the 2008 financial collapse. 
Both Sanders and O'Malley have vowed to reinstate Glass-Steagall. Clinton's Wall Street proposals stop short of that.
